document.discussion_title: Greatest games ever? Where do the achievements of those in Rio stand in Britain's illustrious sporting history...
document.topic_text: Search Greatest games ever? Where do the achievements of those in Rio stand in Britain's illustrious sporting history... On the final morning of these Olympics the number grinning out at us from the medal table was ‘66’. It offered a neat symmetry between England’s World Cup win at Wembley 50 years ago and this feast of sport in Rio de Janeiro. And it prompted us to ask where the glut of British gongs stands in our sporting history. How does it compare to Roger Bannister’s feat at Iffley Road, Oxford, in 1954, when he did what they said could not be done by running the mile under four minutes? Or to Douglas Jardine winning the Ashes by controversially deploying Bodyline? RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next Team... read more Daily Mail , 17 April 2012 in Sport Daily Mail , 1 November 2014 in Sport Wimbledon aftermath: Roger Federer thrilled to be considered one of the greatest sportsmen ever TIGER WOODS tweeted that Roger Federer is the GOAT (greatest of all time) immediately after the tennis ace had claimed his 17th Grand Slam title. Andy Murray also insisted the Swiss superstar should be regarded in the same bracket as sporting icons... Daily Record , 10 July 2012 in Sport Masters 2015: The greatest shots ever played at Augusta National, from 10-1 Ahead of the 79th edition of the Masters, Sportsmail counts down the 20 greatest shots ever seen at Augusta National Golf Club. Here are Nos 10-1. Top Masters shots, Nos 20-11 CLICK HERE for the first part of our countdown, featuring videos of shots... Daily Mail , 8 April 2015 in Sport Masters 2015: The greatest shots ever played at Augusta National, from 20-11 Ahead of the 79th edition of the Masters, Sportsmail counts down the 20 greatest shots ever seen at Augusta National Golf Club. Here are Nos 20-11. 20 Mark O'Meara, 1998 Aged 41, Mark O'Meara's chances of a major championship appeared to have gone... Daily Mail , 8 April 2015 in Sport Liverpool swapping Raheem Sterling for Arsenal's Theo Walcott would be greatest transfer ever, says Paul... Former Arsenal star Paul Merson believes a swap deal involving Raheem Sterling for Theo Walcott plus cash would be the greatest transfer ever…for Liverpool! The Sky Sports pundit also thinks that contract rebel Sterling would not fit into Arsenal’s... Metro , 13 April 2015 in Sport
